description: From -tropism, from geotropism and heliotropism, from Latin tropus (English trope, from Ancient Greek τρόπος (trópos, “a turn, way, manner, style, a trope or figure of speech, a mode in music, a mode or mood in logic”), from τροπή (tropḗ, “turn; solstice; trope”).

entries.meaning: (biology) The turning of an organism in response to a stimulus, either towards or away from the stimulus.
(virology) That type of organ, tissue or cell which supports a certain virus.
